caption.title: Individual samples contributing to the mean time course of infected number in Fig 9.
caption.p: We see that as N increases, the mean length of the run increases. At N = 1000, samples undergo stochastic extinction. At N = 2000, the extinction occurs after a long tail with some runs exhibiting a small recurrence. At N = 4000 and above, the recurrences are stable.
